COMMAND.name: show interface switchport
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the vlan configurations on all bridge ports.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display all VLAN's L2 configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display the vlan configurations on all bridge ports: Switch# show interface switchport Interface name : eth-0-1 Switchport mode : trunk Ingress filter : Enable Acceptable frame types : all Default Vlan : 1 Configured Vlans : 1,100
Interface name : eth-0-2 Switchport mode : trunk Ingress filter : Enable Acceptable frame types : all Default Vlan : 1 Configured Vlans : 1,100
Interface name : eth-0-3 Switchport mode : trunk Ingress filter : Enable Acceptable frame types : all Default Vlan : 1 Configured Vlans : 1,100
COMMAND.CTCRCMD: switchport mode access switchport mode trunk

COMMAND.name: show interface switchport interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the vlan configurations one bridge port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display one VLANâ€™s L2 configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the vlan configurations on one bridge port: Switch# show interface switchport interface eth-0-1 Interface name : eth-0-1 Switchport mode : trunk Ingress filter : Enable Acceptable frame types : all Default Vlan : 1 Configured Vlans : 1,100
COMMAND.CTCRCMD: switchport mode access switchport mode trunk

COMMAND.name: show interface summary
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the summary on all interfaces or an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command will display the summary on all interfaces or an interface in the form of list.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display the summary on the interface eth-0-1.
Switch# show interface summary eth-0-1 RXBS: rx rate (bytes/sec) RXPS: rx rate (pkts/sec) TXBS: tx rate (bytes/sec) TXPS: tx rate (pkts/sec)
Interface Link RXBS RXPS TXBS TXPS ----------+------+--------------+--------------+--------------+-------------- eth-0-1 UP 0 0 0 0

COMMAND.name: show interface trunk
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the trunk port configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display the trunk information on the interface. DUT1# show interface trunk
Port Encapsulation Status Native VLAN ----------+--------------+----------+----------- eth-0-1 802.1q trunking 1
Port Allowed VLANs on Trunk ----------+-------------------------------------------------------- eth-0-1 1,2

COMMAND.name: switchport
COMMAND.ACTION: cdbctl update/cdb/l3/route_if/${iface}/mode_set_before/switch if [ "$?" != "0" ]; then exit 1 fi usleep 100000 cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/mode/switch if [ "$?" != "0" ]; then usleep 100000 exit 1 else usleep 100000 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure a port to a bridge (layer 2) mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: When using this command to change the mode of a port, all bridge or routing configurations of this port will be cleared and not restored. By default, the port is a switchport.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure a port to bridge mode: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# switchport

COMMAND.name: no switchport
COMMAND.ACTION: cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/mode/routed if [ "$?" != "0" ]; then exit 1 else cdbctl update/cdb/l3/check_l3if_exist/${iface}/wait/500 cdbctl update/cdb/l3/route_if/${iface}/mode_set_before/routed fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure a port to a routing (layer 3) mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: When using this command to change the mode of a port, all bridge or routing configurations of this port will be cleared and not restored. By default, the port is a switchport.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure a port to a port to routing mode: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# no switchport

COMMAND.name: switchport mode
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure the port work in access mode,trunk mode or in QinQ mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: When port mode changed, all the dynamic FDB will be cleared.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to configure the port to access mode. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# switchport mode access
This example shows how to configure the port to trunk mode. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# switchport mode trunk
This example shows how to configure the port to QinQ mode. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# switchport mode dot1q-tunnel

COMMAND.name: no switchport mode
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure the port work in default mode, default mode is access port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: When port mode changed, all the dynamic FDB will be cleared.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure the port to default mode. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# no switchport mode

COMMAND.name: switchport access vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the default VLAN for access port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Before this command is used, port must be set to access port. By default, VLAN should be 1.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure the access port to add to default vlan 10: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# switchport mode access Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# switchport access vlan 10

COMMAND.name: no switchport access vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the default VLAN for access port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Before this command is used, port must be set to access port. By default, VLAN should be 1.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure the access port to restore to default vlan 1: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1f)# no switchport access vlan

COMMAND.name: switchport access allowed vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure whether the specified VLAN flow can pass this trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure the specified VLANs flow pass through the port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport access allowed vlan add 10,11 This example shows how to remove the specified VLANs: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport access allowed vlan remove 10,11

COMMAND.name: switchport trunk native vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure the default VLAN for this trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Before this command is used, port must be set to trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure default vlan 10 for trunk port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport mode trunk Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport trunk native vlan 10

COMMAND.name: no switchport trunk native vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure the default VLAN for this trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Before this command is used, port must be set to trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure default vlan 1 for trunk port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport mode trunk Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no switchport trunk native vlan

COMMAND.name: switchport trunk untagged vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure whether the specified VLAN flow can pass this trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure the specified VLAN flow pass through the port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport mode trunk Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport trunk untagged vlan add 5 This example shows how to configure the all VLAN flow pass through the port: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport trunk untagged vlan remove 5 This example shows how to configure the all VLAN flow can not pass through the port:

COMMAND.name: switchport trunk allowed vlan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure whether the specified VLAN flow can pass this trunk port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure the specified VLAN flow pass through the port: Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport trunk allowed vlan add 10 This example shows how to configure the all VLAN flow pass through the port: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport trunk allowed vlan all This example shows how to configure the all VLAN flow can not pass through the port: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# switchport trunk allowed vlan none
